intro: Erica culcitiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. This species is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing a lush green appearance throughout the year. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
